TumsjeRSf6xOUxC15-0tPg.text: This place is absolutely incredible! The panang curry is something I still think about to this day!Michelin Star level service and all the dishes are presented beautifully.

boGksHK6gt3V8ZwkKJ6cIw.text: i feel bad going here in casual clothes but no one says anything. the decor and atmosphere almost seems too upscale for shorts, flip flops and a t-shirt.  the food is great! there are some unique dishes that alone deserve the 5 star rating such as the squid ink drunken noodles. perhaps this dish isn't for everyone, but i highly suggest trying it out!

OReOh57cZL4qiIHjL-uS_A.text: I hesitate to write or not to write this remark on this restaurant. But being a business owner myself, I decide to let the owner knows. Which I would appreciate if any customer let me know about my products.  I had lunch today  with a girlfriend,  the inside of the restaurant is very lovely, tastefully decorated and peaceful atmosphere,  the servers are all super friendly, courteous and dedicated. Why the 1 star? The food!!!  The prime rib in the  yellow curry was extremely chewy, can't even cut with the knife, it needs to be cooked for at least another 3 hrs,  the black ink drunken noodle was tasteless,  with pieces of very chewy octopus,  battered fishes,  and undercooked beans,  the taste is blah and the combinations seafood items were just place on top of the black ink noodles,  with no flavor at all tied together!  I'm surprised to see so many stars !!  Definitely not for the food.  Definitely will not return,  too bad it's so close to my place!!!

MnzDSNHiwNItc0WKukZlXw.text: My cousins and I had a reservation for 9 people at 6pm. We were greeted and immediately sat at our table when we walked in. Ding! Ding! Ding! Points here because I remember thinking to myself, "MAN! We picked the perfect place!"  Well...that didn't last long. The restaurant was relatively quiet. Very comfortable enviroment. The servers were also very well verse and knowledgeable about the menu. The reason why I'm rating this place 3 stars was because it took them 1.5 hours to get our food out. Not only that but the servers were consistently over promising that the good should be out any minute but it wasnt. They also forgot 2 of our orders.   Sweet thing was they gave us a complimentary dessert for my birthday girl and also sang a song.   Probably wont come back. The food was okay nothing extraordinary.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A strawberry instead of a lemon?! SOLD! Already falling in love with this place.

8mVicgGFbaUA4PkagFigiA.text: Well, it looks like the ball dropped on our 25 person birthday party reservation that I booked a month or so ago. I called 20 minutes before and they did not expect us to be arriving. They tried to service us with just one waiter, but you know it was very difficult. There were 2 or 3 patrons in the restaurant so it wasn't busy.  The food was mediocre and there was a strand of hair in one of our dishes. The good thing is that we had our own private room for our party which was nice. The owner failed to come by and apologize for the confusion. We paid  over $650 with gratuity of 18% included. Oh well. I just hope my mom had a great birthday despite the mishap.

ZF8hZMIq_i_yXynj59rgTw.text: We were the second table guests to arrive this night. Very calming interior after being apprehensive considering the location and shady characters hanging around the parking lot. Our young waiter approached our table almost immediately after our seating. We eventually settled on a Thai iced tea, regular iced tea, two appetizers, a veggie spring roll and the other a breaded fried shrimp plate that included a small but beautiful and delicious salad. For our main entrees, we had the Black squid ink drunken noodles with assorted seafood and the husband had the duck soup noodles. OMG, both were really tasty, good portions, the noodles chewy yet firm, their sauces served with all dishes mentioned each different and enhanced each item. A lot of seafood and duck meat. A lovely place with good service, friendly calm atmosphere and of course excellent food!!!

KrvUeAjrFq9S6_cndGXm0Q.text: Great local spot in the Commercial Center that serves up delicious Thai food in a intimate setting.  Not much to say as this spot has been reviewed hundreds of times, and the place stands the test of time as a local haunt. Classic Vegas dinning experience awaits you when you arrive; great waiters, low key, contemporary space, great drinks and food.  Recommend trying the Arawan Pad Thai as it looks so good, you don't even want to eat it. Nice big prawns, really great spicy noodles that are wrapped in some type of egg based which is phenomenal. Also had the duck noodle soup which was excellent, loved the broth.  Could have that same meal any day of the week, can't wait to go back.  Really cool spot for a date night imo.

K-Oe-8Q3kVen73iELX77WA.text: Looks like a hole from the outside but decent inside and the food was great.  Duck noodle soup was our pick of the bunch..

U-2NZYuTX-L_9KMIupEq3w.text: This place is unbelievably good!  Las Vegas really does Thai right and Arawan is the best around. Everything from the decor to the service is perfect. We were a large group of coworkers in for dinner and the team at Arawan made it a memorable night.  We started with appetizers: Fish patties - good Papaya salad - best I've ever had. Fresh, crunchy and perfectly spicy.  Chicken satay - very good but the highlight was the peanut butter sauce. I've had many but theirs is delicious Main course - yellow curry level 7 heat - this dish was cooked to perfection and I have to say the best Thai curry that I've ever had. Each bite was better and had so much flavor. I could have drank the broth as my drink it was so good! Dessert- Mango pancake with Thai tea ice cream - so unique and just to look at it made me happy  The food is out of this world. The service and presentation is the icing on the cake.  Pricing is reasonable and menu is extensive, stop in you will not regret!

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish patty. Really good!
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow Curry. Out of this world good! Level 7 heat and so so good.

cUPlETlmK4830Aoro_pmhQ.text: "HOLE-IN-THE-WALL"  Don't let the location fool you, this Thai restaurant is sophisticated, elegant, and cheap.   FOOD: My friend and I were craving Thai food and this restaurant was the closest to us. We didn't do any research or read any reviews. We just wanted a quick bite. WE WERE WRONG. This place is fancy and the food is amazing. We played it safe and ordered off the $9.95 lunch menu, which includes soup, a generous portion of noodle or rice dish, and dessert.  Lunch started off with a chicken noodle soup. It featured a rich chicken broth, juicy chicken slices, and wide rice noodles. The broth wasn't the yellow chicken powder or stock... it was a dark brown flavorful but not too salty soup.   I ordered the drunken noodles and my friend ordered a pad Thai. The classic pad Thai featured stir fried medium size rice noodles with egg, bean sprouts topped with ground peanuts -- generous portion, chewy noodles, perfect amount of sweet, salty, and sour seasoning. The drunken noodle featured stir fried with salt noodle, green & white onions, fresh Thai basil, fresh green peppercorns, mushrooms, and a delicate sweet-spicy chili sauce -- also generous portion with an amazing spice kick from the peppercorn.   Finally lunch ended with desert, a creamy blueberry cheesecake slice.   AMBIANCE: Sketchy neighbored (I'm not gonna lie ). You think it would be a mom and pop type restaurant based on the other restaurants nearby, but don't let this this modern restaurant fool you. I walked into a fancy restaurant (it reminded me of an Omakase sushi restaurant), with French music playing (during lunchtime), and patio type chairs. I was confused with what they were trying to accomplish but overall I was blown away.   OVERALL: I was so impressed with their lunch special that I will 100% come back to this side of town for dinner. If you are ever in the neighborhood, I highly recommend the 3-course lunch special. I can't wait to come back to try the curries, salads, other noodle dishes, and desserts.

okeelMexr1TMzXzSEpFtig.text: Great place! You would never know from the outside. Place is so cute inside. The staff and the food is all 5 stars.!!!!

BGjAFkn2AdUwCQJ9BxjGXw.text: This place is one of the best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas.  My girlfriend and I came here on a late Saturday night, and were seated immediately.    Outside surrounding the restaurant is a run down area, with lots of other businesses and plenty of sketchy looking people walking around.  Walking into this restaurant you will see a beautiful interior, with tables and some bar seating.  The service, excellent.  The food, amazing.  Overall a perfect experience for the two of us.  The perfect ambiance for a date.  We ordered the Rib Eye Numtok and the Arawan Pad Thai.  Both dishes came out photo worthy and were so tasty!  The Rib Eye Numtok was ordered with medium spice, and was very flavorful.  None of the ingredients overpowered another.  It comes with lettuce but I'm sure it would be delicious paired with some rice as well.  The Arawan Pad Thai.. now that dish is something.  A bunch of noodles with egg lace and 2 prawns on top.  This dish was the star of dinner, bursting with flavor that made me want more.  We'll be back to try the dessert next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye Numtok.
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arawan Pad Thai.

UmD4xtQ946XMgD1EpQDRaA.text: The best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas! Oh No, the best in US!  5 stars for the amazing food and 5 stars for the great service!  Here were what we ordered:  1. Arawan Pad Thai: $22     It was totally an art! So yummy! I can't tell How cool is this dish! But everybody has to try it if you get a chance.   2. Squid Ink drunken noodle: $26     This is a high end version of drunken noodle. Love this squid ink sooooo much!  3. Scallops green curry: $28     Came with 3 large scallops, even if it costs more, but it totally deserves the price!   4. Soft shell crab salad: $19     The salad was not that special, but the soft shell crab was very large and crispy! So we ordered extra  2, we cannot get enough of the crabs!   5. Mango paradise: $10     This is also another high end version of mango sticky rice. With very fresh mangoes and two kind of sticky rice.   6. Fried soft shell crab for 2: $10      The server knew we were celebrating our anniversary in Las Vegas, she offered us a free dessert----strawberry ice cream with fresh strawberries. Very yummy and so sweet of this restaurant! Will totally come back when we are in Vegas next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arawan Pad Thai
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid Ink Drunken Noodles
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango paradise

sNFIhdJu5qIBTYwaC7Drxg.text: We selected this restaurant because we couldn't get into Lotus of Siam. The reviews looked great and we had vegetarians in our party. We went for my husbands birthday. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious!!!  We ordered the calamari and it was light, crispy and flavorful. I ordered the drunken noodles with shrimp. Flavor profiles were complicated and amazing. We ordered the pineapple fried rice and was probably the best fried rice I've ever tasted. Even the lemonade was delicious - a perfect combination of sweet and sour.   The last surprise was a special dessert they brought for my husband. I asked if they did anything when I booked the reservation. I couldn't have asked for anything better. Thanks so much and we will definitely be back!  My stomach is happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday desert!

EpxUi_Bqabs96aHey8KtFQ.text: My husband and I were really disappointed with this place.  We had high expectations since reviews were pretty solid.  We got the rib eye nam tok / short rib yellow curry / crab fried rice / Tom yum shrimp.    The rib eye nam tok : the beef was boiled .. not grilled or even pan fried. That was prolly one of the bad thing you can do for the meat.  The salad itself was tasty bc of the seasoning .  But the boiled meat ruined it .   The short rib yellow curry : literally more like curry soup and it was sweet and not flavorful. They only give you one short rib. Also a rip off !!  The crab fried rice .  Nothing special ..   Tom yum shrimp soup .. I thought it was $11 for a small.. but when the bill came it was $12.  I mean it's not much of  a difference but it should have been clearly listed.    I'm not sure if there are any good Thai good in Las Vegas anymore .  The other competitive one also went down the drain when they moved to their newest location

OHaocFT8B28sPDE_PndPbQ.text: So good!  Much better than I thought it would be.  I had the prawns with red curry and pineapples.  It was the special.  So good.  And the mango with sticky rice?  So good.  I'm a local in Vegas and I'll be coming back.

uq2wOnwspLYZlVUGzDmDZg.text: Came here with some old coworkers and former boss for a going away lunch for one of my old coworkers. The restaurant sits in the middle building of commercial center, where the popular Lotus of Siam used to be near. I'd call this another "hidden gem" in an area you'd never think to have good food. I was told Arawan took over the spot where Tokyo Japanese Restaurant used to be. Renovations had changed the interior to a more up-scale, borderline almost fine dining style Thai restaurant with their logo to the back wall of the restaurant. I had felt mildly underdressed when walking into this restaurant, but oh well. Lol   The table we sat at was a bar height table w/ stools. On the side with 2 chairs, it seemed mildly "squished" as the width was perfect for the chairs, and chairs only. lol  My former boss had been here before so i let her do all the ordering for the table. Everyone was served water with a piece of strawberry in it. Wouldn't exactly say strawberry infused water, just more of like a decoration. Lol   Complimentary crispy wonton skins with a chili-lime sauce   Simple wonton skins fried and a chili lime sauce on the side that adds a nice punch to the "fried" aspect of the wonton skins  "Egg Papaya Salad" - Shrimp, salted egg, green papaya, tomatoes, crisp green beans, crushed almonds, thai pork sausage, pork rind and spicy-sweetnam-pla chili-lime dressing  Very bright green papaya salad w/ tomatoes, green beans, almonds w/ a chili-lime dressing w/ a mountain of fried pork skin/rind/chicharons that was yummy to dip in the dressing. Always a favorite of mine to get papaya salad at thai restaurants   "Ahi Tuna Larb" - Ahi tuna tossed in a spicy lime dressing with rice powder, mango, avocado, shallot, green onion, carrot, and cilantro-served w/ crispy wontons  Larb is typically known as a meat dish w/ chili, mint, veggies and some sort of sour aspect (lime or another souring agent). In this case, it was fresh, raw ahi tuna tossed in a spicy lime dressing w/ mango, avocado, shallots, carrots served w/ crispy wonton and "cups" made with iceberg lettuce. In a way its like a lettuce wrap, but not. The spicy lime dressing and mango brightens the flavor of the tuna w/ added sweetness and crunch from shallots and carrots making a yummy appetizer to have.   "Plum Shrimp" - Crispy egg noodle-wrapped jumbo shrimp w/ side of orange plum sauce  Overall pretty yummy. Would have preferred a little less amount of egg-noodles wrapped around. Kind of "masks" the shrimp but the orange plum sauce adds a nice flavor overall to the crispy noodles.   "Crab Fried Rice" - Crab meat stir-fried w/ rice, egg, tomato, and onion  A "simple" but delicate fried rice w/ fresh crab meat, egg, cherry tomatoes, and onion. The crab and egg was perfectly cooked so the both egg and crab was not dry and tough.   "Crispy Duck" - Crispy-fried marinated duck in five spices served w/ house lime-chili sauce  The duck itself was mildly dry but flavorful overall. I think they removed most/all the bones besides the "drumstick" making it for easy eating.   "Tenderloin Black Pepper" - Beef tenderloin topped with black pepper sauce, garlic, green onion, white onion, bell pepper, and pepper-corn  Super tender beef tenderloin w/ a rich black pepper sauce with tons of veggies and fresh green peppercorns. Not so much of a fan of the veggies but this was my first time having fresh green peppercorns. They were surprisingly not spicy, doesn't pack a punch, but mildly sweet in flavor too along with the pepper taste. Tenderloin w/ black pepper sauce and fresh green peppercorns on a plate of rice, and id be happy any day !   "Crispy Lemongrass Catfish" - Whole catfish crispy-fried and topped w/ lemongrass, fresh mint, mango, red onion, garlic, cashew nuts, tomatoes, green onion, cilantro, crispy basil served with homemade green apple semi-spicy dressing  The "main event" of the lunch was a WHOLE catfish fried to perfection topped with many items. The skin was perfectly crispy, even the OTHER side after we had removed and ate all the meat from one half of the fish. The green apple semi-spicy dressing adds a great bright flavor on top of all of the fresh toppings that was on the fish as well.   Unfortunately, the pastry chef was not in the restaurant and had "just stepped out" according to our waiter, so we were not able to order any desserts. Other tables seemed to have been given ice cream or sliver's of cake but we were not given anything. Not sure if this is a normal occurrence at this restaurant or what the reason was. Maybe only available if you order lunch special? I don't know. There was a dessert my former boss really wanted us to try but unfortunately, we couldn't.   Overall, the lunch was really good. Flavor of everything was fairly on point. Though for a party of 5, it was pretty pricey but i guess for the quality in ingredients used, it was really good.   Service was pretty good. They kept my water glass filled and never completely empty.

zAz0ckqk4OXtI3XtkseU7g.text: Great experience! It is definitely a whole in the wall. I was out driving and craving Thai food.  I was 10 minutes away and clicked the first recommendation that came up.    When pulling into the plaza I was confused.  It was definitely a diamond in the rough.    I got the lunch special. $9.99 for a cup of soup, chicken pad Thai and a little dessert.  It was so worth it! Highly recommended and will be making the drive to come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad Thai after I stirred it all together!

d9pTDcWgKZKwnyQ2FS9Cvw.text: So I got a recommendation from my professor about going here if I ever was craving some good Thai food. My friends and I went here Friday afternoon for lunch and we were all pleased. Its located in a very opened area plaza, looks a little dead and weird at first though. It was also a bit hard for us to find it, but thanks to yelp we saw pictures of the outside and were on the look out for the red roof building.   So we went in and decided to all get something from their lunch menu. The lunch menu gave sufficient enough portions to satisfy our appetite. For about $10, you get their soup of the day (it changes each day), a choice of entree from their lunch menu (they have a variety), and then Thai Tea Ice Cream for dessert! Also if you check in on Yelp, you get a free Thai Iced Coffee! The coffee was very good, a definite must get & plus it's free, so why not?? So all that for just $10 is a great deal for lunch! Also, they're so fancy to the point where they put a slice of strawberry in your water! Really, the whole restaurant was very fancy. Very nice interior and decor, the staff were very friendly and attentive asking how we were doing or if we needed anything else. I really like that when it comes to customer service.   Onto the food. So I ordered their yellow curry and my choice of protein was beef. When mine was brought out it was very nicely plated. The curry was flavored well, thick, and with a good amount of beef and veggies. It also came with a portion of rice as well so eating it all definitely filled me up! The soup of the day we got was Chicken Tom Yum! Mmmm! My favorite! The broth wasn't too spicy, sweet or tangy. It was very aromatic and flavorful and definitely a good appetizer before the main entree came out. Finally, dessert time! The ice cream was creamy and you could definitely tell there was True thai tea flavor in it. Not too sweet with their ice cream too. A great ending to a delicious Thai lunch.

Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow Curry with Beef (lunch menu item)

zC4UaI1edAkmsN1uWJLqdA.text: I left a very large stainless steel water bottle here last night. I called the next day to confirm it was in safe keeping before going to retrieve it, & the gentleman said he didn't find anything. WOW! So your staff are thieves, then? Real nice. And YES I KNOW it was there because I went straight home afterwards & it wasn't in my car. You may think, "why would anyone steal your water bottle??" I have 2 guesses. 1) it's a very nice, expensive water bottle. OR 2) the greedy server wasn't satisfied with my 20% tip & stole it "just because". Either way - WRONG.  As for the food & service: Despite being served by 4 different servers & only getting one refill the entire meal, it was still ok food. Nothing spectacular, but it's good. If you're a sucker for ambiance opposed to QUALITY OF FOOD I say go for it. If you pay no mind to filthy bathrooms, unsanitary conditions & you're ok paying more for the "presentation" & "facade", then I say GO FOR IT! LOL But if you'd rather save a few bucks & get the SAME quality food, I'm happy to offer some other, better suggestions.  I don't recommend substituting the arawan shrimp roll for a veggie roll, they will rip you off BIG TIME. I wish I snapped a pic of how pathetic this $8 roll looked. And it was NOT FRESH BTW. Literally NOTHING like the size on the menu. They also give you this bomb-a** sauce with about 4 tiny fried chips as your appetizer. The sauce is great but um, WHHHY do they give 4 pieces of nothing to eat it with??? LOL Give us spring rolls instead! The water tasted odd but my chow mein & tom kha was delic' (at $10 for a TINY BOWL!) I was like "did I order some tom kha or did I order a french onion soup?!" LOL You can get a soup that feeds 2-3 people for $2 more at MOST thai places! C'mon people!! My bf also liked his pineapple fried rice.  I actually brought him here for a New Years treat because I thought this was a more "high end" thai place. But once we got our appetizer, I knew it was more about the facade & hype. As for us - we will not be giving them another dime since they obviously think it's ok to steal private property from their paying customers. As for the management at Arawan - WAY TO GO hiring dishonest, thieving employees!

ywfA-J9z1Kry6URy1Y7IbA.text: Sketchy neighborhood but good service, food, and atmosphere in this gem. They bring water glasses to the table with a slice of strawberry in them. A colorful nice touch. Not something you see in most restaurants. I got Pad Se Ew. It could have used a tad more flavor but generally good. Chicken Satay was good.

CO1NlSJWz2f6mLyJZKxA6A.text: Arawan is a Thai restaurant located in the same strip mall as the original Lotus of Siam restaurant(my favorite Thai restaurant in the States). It was a spontaneous lunch date since I was pressed for time for my flight back to LA.   The restaurant was actually larger than what I expected. It was nicely decorated and the chairs were super comfortable. It was simple, yet elegant.   The menu itself was large but not overwhelming. There was a variety of the usual dishes to choose from, i.e. noodles, soup, curries and rice dishes. I wanted to stick with their most popular dishes.  Larb ($14.00): Ground chicken tossed in spicy lime dressing with rice powder, red onion, green onion and cilantro-served with lettuce. The larb was actually quite tasty. We asked for mild and it was the perfect level of spice. I  thought it was refreshing since the lime cut through the heaviness of the dish.    KA MOO ARAWAN ($15.00): Stew pork hog with boiled egg and steam Chinese broccoli. This dish was nothing special. It was tasty, but reminded me of a Chinese dish my mom would make than a Thai dish. It has a slightly sweet taste from the soy sauce and the Chinese broccoli was cooked perfectly.   MY FAVORITE DISH. ARAWAN PAD THAI ($22.00): Fresh prawn wok-stir fried in a tamarind sauce with rice noodle, slice chicken, peanut, green onions and bean sprouts-wrapped with lattice egg and side of crushed peanuts. This dish was amazing. I normally wouldn't care for pad thai, but the watier recommended it and said it was one of the most popular dishes. Seriously though, I can totally see why...it's beautifully presented and there was tons of flavor. The pad thai wasn't overly sauced and it wasn't dry either. It was made perfectly. At $22, it better be though.   DUCK RED CURRY ($18.00): Roasted duck in a red curry coconut milk broth with red peppers, zucchini, tomato, grapes, pineapple, asparagus and sweet basil leaves. The flavor of the curry was good but it wasn't anything memorable. I thought the duck was quite dry and it was disappointing. The pineapple was actually a nice touch to the dish but that was the only thing great about it. I would pass.    Overall, I thought Arawan is a decent Thai spot if you want a change from Lotus of Siam. The place is also known for desserts, but unfortunately, they do not serve it during lunch. The service was good, always making sure the water was full. The food was served pretty fast as well. I think what made this place stick out was the pad thai and I would literally just visit Arawan for that noodle dish.

cp1z2OzIRbGOtdPfwP_QPg.text: Best thai food around! Not only the best thai food yet but fairly good price. My friend and I ordered lunch special for 9.99 if you order one dish which was pad thai that comes with egg drop soup, salad and dessert! Fresh thin looking noodle with the pad thai! I also ordered on a side of appetizers chicken satay..so delicious! They even added a small butter bread underneath satay which has a amazing taste in your mouth. If you guys ever come there Kat is the best server! She'll make you feel welcoming and comfortable. Usually server just wants your money and careless about your well being but this servest cares more than that. I recommend you this beautiful place!

OBCdGrSDmUXvY3J7iuK-aA.text: I ordered delivery to my hotel.  Delivery was quick and the driver was nice.  I ordered the arawan fresh roll with shrimp, spicy mint and spicy green beans.  Portions were small.  The fresh roll was basically lettuce and a cut up shrimp.  The main dishes lacked any depth.  When you think of a dish that boasts of chili garlic basil you'd expect a whole lot of flavor.  Ii got bland food that bordered on Chinese.  Not even close to lotus of Siam.

pX-7a5YIIQtu-2-xiLJRCg.text: This place is a diamond in a rough. We were visiting Las Vegas and were looking for a good Thai food. From Yelp review, we went there but were a bit scared about the location. The food and desserts were well worth it! We highly recommend Grilled rib-eye steak salad with rice powder, fish cake, mango with sticky rice, and crispy pancake with Thai ice tea cream. **My descriptions aren't the actual names of the food at this place.** You cannot skip desserts!!

aGGToGQPI2c4GPEiTCViDw.text: The best Thai restaurant in town. THE BEST. Period. Fresh food, healthy (no MSG!!!), delicious and amazing service. Been there 30 times if not more. By far the best in town. Enjoy!

LYVXMEiH9jRQfuhP_XTUuQ.text: This was really delicious Thai food. We had the roasted duck red curry which was pretty amazing and the ribeye basil dish which was fantastic. The service was also top notch. Very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

92KQ2vpSs3V5XWuAaUi9Mw.text: I've been there twice and it is my "go-to" place in Las Vegas for Thai food. (No, I haven't been to the "other" Thai restaurant.  Each dish is not only a culinary delight, but a work of art as well.  The staff is gracious and attentive, but not overbearing.  At lunch we had the special.  I had the garlic pork, and my colleague had the drunken noodles.  The garlic pork was very tasty, but could have had a little more "gravy" (just a personal preference).  For dessert my colleague had the Creme Brulee and I had a banana pan that wasn't on the website menu, but be assured that it was excellent  I visit Las Vegas 6-10 times a year and each time I travel, if I can get there, I eat at Arawan.

bbXAIyoo6mUDxrMd5DHuRg.text: Amazing pork stew...tasted like roast duck lol  Crab fried rice was not fishy at all, very yummy   Calamari was good so was the chicken satay   The chicken pad seewu wasn't too greasy!  Definitely would return

oABTj_pcY3oIie1XEF5GCg.text: Where do I start? The decor? Gorgeous. Not crazy omg I'm in Vegas. Just so very unexpected for a Thai restaurant in the Commercial Center. Understated. Modern. Great for a date. Not stuffy while still impressive. The customer service? Perfect blend of being on top of things without interruptions. And a very good looking staff, if I may say so.  The food? I can't believe the presentation of the Pad Thai. Long story short, it's wrapped in a cage made of egg. Topped by a perfect pair of incredible prawns. They might be shrimp, but that just doesn't seem good enough to describe these massive and succulent beasts. The noodles are perfectly cooked and seasoned. Sometimes Pad Thai can be too sweet or taste like Vinegar. Not here. Perfectly presented and cooked, this is the new standard in Vegas Pad Thai.   We also had Spicy Mint beef. Terrible. If terrible means freaking amazing! It was not spicy hot but full of spices and flavor. Our last main course was chicken curry. Again, the layers of flavor were insanely complex while not assaulting the palate. Lol, I seriously just used palate in a sentence. Slow down James Beard.   For dessert it was suggested we try the special. It was valentine's day. My best friend and I are not remotely a couple. But the lady obviously assumed we were and suggested we share the chocolate cake with strawberry ice cream. We giggled but I was truly impressed that if we had been a couple of guys on a date, we wouldn't have been made to feel uncomfortable. As two gay guys we were treated just like everyone else and actually encouraged to just be ourselves. That's huge. That chocolate cake? It took 10 m minutes. Why? It was freshly made to order and filled with hot strawberry filling. Topped by a heart shaped macaroon that was most definitely not from a box and homemade strawberry ice cream you know from the first bite to the point where you'd lick the plate if you were at home, this dessert indicates a True pastry chef is in the kitchen. In fact, no matter where you decide to eat in the Commercial Center, or Downtown, save some room and eat your dessert here. You won't be disappointed.   I've been eating Thai food for over thirty years and I'm not a huge fan of Lotus with Komol fairing a little better. This place reminds me of the best places in Little Thailand in Los Angeles. Please eat here. We need this place to thrive!

Mzt1jQuRnsMqxhiwCyPtBg.text: Have gone in for lunch three times now and this place totally hits the mark, seemingly without even trying hard.  The food is first rate; the service is unobtrusive and top notch plus the staff is friendly and helpful.  The decor is cool and you have your choice of seating, including one area without chairs if that is your desire.   This appears to be all family run, as we have chatted with the greeter (the father) the mother, who is the cook, 2 sons who are waiters and the daughter who is the pastry chef. Lunch specials here include drink & dessert and are all under 10 bucks.  Portions are generous.  I am a big guy and I always leave full.  This place is fresh, clean and comfortable, and is (IMHO) definitely on a par with Lotus of Siam, which is a neighbor in this multi use center.  You have a fan, Arawan...  I'll be back soon.

lq4ipsECdFayOfJvBNm8_Q.text: This is my new favorite Thai restaurant. After heading to Cornish Pasty Company on a hunt for more unique desserts, we spotted Arawan and knew we had to try it. It took a couple of months, but we finally made it and are so glad we did.  The place wasn't very busy, but it certainly should be! It's got a more upscale, romantic vibe than most Thai restaurants, and all the employees were very friendly and open to giving suggestions.   We started with chicken satay, which was delicious, but that's hard to mess up. In Thailand, we love stopping by the beach for fresh fried fish but had yet to find another restaurant locally that could recreate those flavors...until now. The fried catfish was amazing with the perfect batter and a slightly spicy lemongrassy sauce that I wanted to drink. The fish is also huge so plenty of food for two or even three if you order more appetizers.  We ended with the Mango Island dessert, which was full of flavors and textures. I can't wait to try the other desserts on the menu, none of which are simple.  It seems a lot of customers are overflow from Lotus of Siam. I personally prefer the food here, although the menu isn't as extensive. I also didn't get sick after dinner like I have every time I've gone to LoS. The food tastes fantastic and is presented beautifully, making Arawan a full experience rather than just a place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Island dessert

qjB8keX6yvD_HSE7U1GHGg.text: The best Thai restaurant ever. Great good and really friendly people. Thank you Drake we will visit again for sure

Cjzz-1b8Ghy4BnmcSggZkg.text: Wow! What a great experience. We were warmly greeted by the staff in the parking lot as we were having a hard time finding this diamond of Thai food in Las Vegas. We ended up having the shrimp pad see ew and the red curry chicken with a cucumber salad and satay as a opener. It was the best Thai food we have ever experienced. Couple that with "Apple" our server who was right on top of our every need made it a must return spot for us in Las Vegas. Go and enjoy Arawan for yourself!!

fUvIvCoTmbAQ9eFY5qlpJg.text: Stepping through the doors transports one from the decrepit Commercial Center into a  beautifully decorated, bright and impeccably clean dining room.  We were greeted cheerfully on entering and experienced similar hospitality throughout our meal.  Our visit was scheduled in order to take advantage of the 3-course, $9.95 luncheon special that is offered on weekdays.  The first course of egg drop soup is not what comes to mind when dining in a Thai restaurant though it was probably the lightest and best we have ever experienced.  Entrees of Pad Thai and BBQ chicken were shared with the former being slightly over sauced while the latter a tad overdone though the wing and thigh meat were juicy.  The last course was a raspberry panna cotta that was a light and delicious conclusion to our filling meal.

We ordered the soft shell crab, thai bbq chix, panang curry and crab fried rice along with the delectable dessert, mango island...all of them are delicious and satisfying. Our servers, Pong and Apple were so attentive and were so friendly, always have a smile on their faces while tending to our needs. I would definitely come back and highly recommend this as one of the best Thai restaurants here in Las Vegas that I've been to.

The drunken noodles were the best I have ever had.  The best part of the meal were the desserts, we had the banana puff and raspberry lava cake. The waiter was also very courteous. 5NNdfoOF2XdabsIhFCZt0w.text: Best Thai place in town. The lunch special is $9.95 and includes soup, salad, main meal, and a desert. The service is as good as it gets. We come here every other week.

sDkgTdO5EM2o2rJBJ6Ppuw.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I walked into Arawan and how nice the atmosphere and ambience was. I had the lunch special chicken drunken noodles and my husband had the shirt rib yellow curry. With my noodles I also got a salad,soup and a dessert all for 9.95. We also has their calamari and egg rolls as appetizers. Service was excellent. I think this might be my new favorite Thai place. We will be back.

PcF1Cb57gukTzoJBA25MSw.text: We're a locals and we love to try different places and different kind of foods..it is our first time here at Arawan and we had a blast!! Foods are great and the above & beyond customer service of our server named "KAY!!" Surely we'll be back here

4-g6AqlJxkH4-6F2MrLnTg.text: Had an excellent experience at Arawan.  I was dining alone and struggling with a cold.  The server, Kay, offered to make me a vegan Thai soup to help my cold and that's what I had.  It was great: very clean and fresh, it actually did make me feel better.  Thank you, Kay.  I look forward to sampling more of the menu next time I'm in the area.

q0VdZ5EomH6bmD64exqKAQ.text: Best Thai food ever!  Incredible, amazing, and delicious!  The food was flavorful and perfect blend spices.  The curry was bowl licking good.  The Tom Kai was right the right amount of spice and delicious.  Try to Thai local favorites which are special and unique to be added to our favorite dishes.  The ambulance was comfortable and elegant but casual.  We will take all our close friends here!

xNpVMT2NiMMTU90slgSczQ.text: The atmosphere was nicer than it would seem from the outside. Service was a bit on the slow side. Food was great, portion sizes were perfect. If you like you're food spicy as I do you may want to specify that. We ordered the calamari appetizer and then I had the Arawan Pad Thai, ordered as extra spicy. The dipping sauce that came with the calamari was spicier than the pad thai. My wife had the Rib Eye with Crispy Thai Basil and the flavors were excellent, as was the pad thai.  My only complaints would be the level of spice and the fact that my pad thai came with head on prawns.

2Xm_NcM54E0_jYIEqWg7sg.text: First off, I love the vibe of this place. I was a little surprised to hear light jazz in the background of a Thai restaurant, but it worked well with the overall setting. The decor is as hip as any new restaurant can be without feeling pretentious.  The food was all light and fresh, with just a very subtle hint of spiciness. The Arawan Fresh Rolls are similar to spring rolls you'll get elsewhere. The Pad See Ew was great, and not as oily as Lotus of Siam. The Ribeye Crispy Basil is one of the more expensive things on the menu, but totally worth it - lightly pan fried Thai basil leaves atop slices of ribeye steak and thinly-sliced veggies with young green Thai peppercorns. Dee-lish. The Spicy Mint (ground beef) was tasty, too. I could have done without the Fried Tofu appetizer, but I don't think it's on the menu they're about to debut.  Con: No liquor license yet (as of 8/5/2015)

Z4GhbpvTaebyZh2XTePq7A.text: This has easily become my definite go-to Thai restaurant around the Strip. I've found this hidden gem only recently and I wish I could have known it sooner. Arawan has everything I love as much as Thai restaurant can get: Great authentic Thai food? checked. Top quality service? checked. Plenty of free parking? checked. Fantastic desserts? double-checked!! If you haven't done so already, do yourself a favor and tryout their desserts like the Earthquake, Mango Island, and the Sweet Sensation Creme brulee. You're welcome.

6_4NGtgUBLx8R01jancUrg.text: Very good service. Not your typical Thai restaurant. Food was great! Try the crispy catfish. But u'll need at least 4 people to eat it. Also had the pad see ew, yellow curry, ribeye basil. All good food  Loved the desserts too! Real vanilla bean in the creme brulee. Thai tea ice cream with the banana crepe was delish! Yummm!!

Rkj4sdf9s9yxOP25BcyKOg.text: Unbelievably amazing food and amazing, friendly staff. I was in town for a business event, and I found this place by chance. This is a must try and don't be fooled by the location. I will definitely be coming back here on my next Vegas visit!! Thank you to the staff for the amazing service and food!!! :)

O4PARSsubj1vAGxrBaiXFA.text: Delicious Thai food off the strip.  The restaurant was pleasant inside and our server was terrific!  The Ahi Tuna Larb was to die for!  The basil Fried Rice with chicken was also amazing.

HlsUuwEyfk6_GzwUvk_9IQ.text: We came across the nice Thai restaurant inside commercial center. Pleasantly surprised with very new updated interior. I would give it a solid 9 for decoration and surroundings. Very clean and modern decor. The food presentation of each and every platter we order a solid 10. We had several of the appetizers and each one was superb in presentation. The food taste gets an 8 except for the soup we had - now that gets a 10 for taste. My favorite Thai dish is pad Thai and though we ordered the Arawan pas Thai it fell short. It was mainly the noddles, no peanuts (I've always eaten pad Thai with peanuts), and the only protein on this platter was one large prawn sliced in half and nicely decorated ontop. Would I return? Yes I would but will be ordering something other than the pad Thai. And hoping that next time we are there, they have their alcohol license straightened out. On this trip they didn't sell any alcohol and on a Friday night after working all week a glass of wine or a beer would have been great.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8AhheZ4Lsq5ayu0L35GWKQ.text: I am glad we found this place. The food and desserts were delicious! The presentation of their dishes were very eye appealing and tasty as well. Their Arawan Pad Thai is by far the most pretty Pad Thai dish I have seen on all Thai restaurants I have been to. Try it! The lemongrass chicken wings were very tasty as well. We were full, but could not resist in trying their desserts. Beautifully decorated and very delicious. I really enjoyed the ambiance of this place. Very modern and spacious. I would definitely come back here when I am in Las Vegas. Thank you for a lovely dinner experience.

gAHlnIuCQ1qrSnYGidtkEQ.text: I would highly recommend going to Lotus of Siam for Thai food instead of this place (it's in the same Parking lot) I would give this place a zero if possible. I came at lunch time and ordered the ribeye crispy basil and the soft shell crab (both are specials) I asked for the ribeye to be cooked medium rare (meaning just some pink in the middle) instead it came out seared so very rare and chewy. The softshell crab dish was way below average and expectations as well. The restaurant wasn't so busy during lunch and the waitress never came over to ask how everything was until the end of the meal. They were also having their own lunch and the whole staff including cooks was more interested in their own meal. I think the cooks rushed the ribeye in order to sit down and eat their own lunch. I said something to the waitress finally but they didn't do anything to fix it, just said sorry. I paid $71 for a meal that wasn't even eaten with horrible service. I would recommend going to Lotus of Siam! It's in the same parking lot area as this restaurant they have a bigger selection of specialty dishes that are actually appetizing.

v9MUZydufCxdfdU1V69PXA.text: We live in the area but this has become one of our favorite restaurants for thai. Service is exceptional and decor is date night special. Small room off of main dining for small group. Close to strip. Do not miss!  We are so happy to have another fabulous thai restaurant so near.

rC8VzyizACS7EkOA8Kb0RA.text: We love Arawan! The food is delicious! There is no better Thai food in Vegas. We have been coming to Arawan since they have been open at their old location. We LOVE the Pad Thai and their desserts are absolutely delicious and beautiful! The sticky rice is great and the Thai pancakes are good too.  This is a great place for date night! And the lunch menu is a great price! It comes with desert and a little bowel of soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The desserts are so good that there will never be anything left to take home!
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the yellow curry lunch special!

mZbj_F08JhbRpK8Y-10HKA.text: Impressive from the beginning. We were a huge party of 14 and we called twice to change our reservation time and they were very accommodating. Even though it's in a run down complex and looks not-so-great from the outside, once you enter, it's a completely different experience. Very nicely decorated, the ambience is almost romantic and way better than even Lotus of Siam, whose food we loved! :) Our table was ready when we arrived. While we ordered we were served complimentary fried wantons with the sweet and spicy sauce, which was good. A few of us had to take a flight back soon, and they were very accommodating in getting their food orders in and out first. We ordered a lot of items (Chicken Satay, Panang Curry Chicken, Red Curry Chicken, Veg and Chicken Pad Thais) and all of them were very good. The only items that I will not order again are the Green Curry Scallops. They were definitely not fresh and smelled fishy and chewy, though the gravy was very yummy.  I would also critique the amount of white rice (paid) served which is very less. The desserts are a must-have. We tried the Mango Sticky Rice, The Banana Puffs and the Affogato. All were really really good. All-in-all, a great experience!

8PHCAraIwwkNUcHC-8AckQ.text: Excellent! Best Thai resto in Vegas. Great ambience and service, and the food was amazing! Will definitely come back!

JdrEram_mX2PRcXpRLFQmA.text: We had the signature Pad Thai and it was awesome. Two giant salted prawns atop the traditional pad Thai noodles. It was better than most and was enough to share around True table. The green curry chicken and curry short ribs were also quite tasty and equally filling.  Thankfully we left room for desert her CHEF Gail shines   Do not leave without sampling some of her desert creations. We had the chocolate mousse cake and fried banana with green tea ice cream and orange cookie. They looked so good we were reluctant to cut into them. Two deserts wee plenty for our party of three. The deserts capped a great dining experience. Food was excellent, service attentive without being annoying and good value for the money. Definitely worth checking out. One note: as of our visit they have not yet received their liquor license. They have applied and expect to be serving shortly.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Be sure to leave room for desert! Chef Gail definitely hits the mark.
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arawan&#39;s Dignature Pad Thai speaks for itself.

E5qeZT3Jo5Hmfh4WrilZAw.text: Great atmosphere, quiet music in the background, great for conversation.  Have the Lechee Black Tea hot and order it right away to allow it time to steep.  The red curry fish cakes and calamari with their respective sauces are really great, the Pad Woon Sen was marvelous as well as the squid ink drunken noodles.  Portions are enough for two, very well prepared and presented.  Staff is polite, helpful, courteous, and thoughtful.  Restaurant  is clean and has a great atmosphere.  We will be back again

peCPJFno_gr0o3tq-GhoFw.text: Arawan moved to the commercial center and is better than ever.  We started going when it was sticky Rice and loved it.  This new spot is great and the food as good.  Lots of parking available, lovely staff and cool ambiance.  Shrimp pad thai and curry are my fav

0ajhLoy5-FeQdaRCL1F3bw.text: Coming back here after 2 years and I love it even more! This is not your regular traditional Thai restaurant, it's a place with beautiful decoration, relaxing music, friendly service and tasty food with innovative presentation. This is the place that I said to myself: screw that diet after 3 Vegas buffets, just not today! We finished up every bits in the plates, so clean that they don't need to wash our dishes    Started with the fresh rolls, main course were duck drunken noodles and short ribs yellow curry, ended with refreshing coconut ice cream dessert. It's so perfect and I think I had a food orgasm

jLQK_Ao5z5wc6UUwd5y8dQ.text: One of the best Thai foods I've ever had. The cuisines were made with twists. Everything we have ordered were sooo sooo delicious! My favorite is Pad Thai. The cat fish served was really humungous. It is a must-try restaurant if ever you are in Las Vegas. The desserts were scrumptious, still daydreaming of the thai tea ice cream. Lastly, service was impeccable. They were all attentive and our glasses were never empty with water. The interior of the place was definitely unexpected, very clean and great ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Bvv1iPolxKAW0zutsMnbQ.text: Wonderful food! We ordered the chicken satay and crispy shrimp appetizers on happy hour. Both were very well prepared and flavorful. We had the Panang curry and Arawan pad Thai, both were amazing. Very friendly staff and pleasant atmosphere, although it's not in the best location. Don't let that deter you. It's well worth the trip once you step through the doors, rather than pay 3x as much for mediocre Thai at a fancy hotel on the strip.

2-ze-SvtwZY9sVapfD67tA.text: What can I say, this place was awesome. From the Tea (best Jasmine Pearl Tea I've ever had) to the Beef Panang to their amazing deserts, I very much enjoyed this place. Totally unexpected.  We got here kinda by accident, we where trying to go to another thai restaurant but the wait was too long, we pulled Yelp out and took a Lyft over. As we approached I was a little worried because of the location, a sketchy looking strip mall. BUT do not let the location deter you. This place is amazing. When in Vegas and hankering for some Thai, this is the place to go.  Thanks for the awesome food.

JFSxj9GUP_jFjc-kPnmLig.text: What a great find, the food was awesome. I ordered the Thai calamari followed by the Pad Thai with Duck. Well worth the trip

OBt_wav5TZLK3DJchf47ow.text: The strip mall is a little sketchy, but it's really not any sketchier than Las Vegas as a whole. Excellent food, cute restaurant. Definitely good for a quite, yummy dinner off the strip.

TAqsAkh_pfhvsmyvzslOgA.text: Superb!! We enjoyed our dinner from beginning to end. Arawan is definitely in my top three of Thai restaurants in Las Vegas.  Like most Yelp reviews these are the musts haves for your first visit (though what ever you explore on the menu will be well worth your venture) but for the first visit..... ARAWAN PAD THAI..... Immaculate presentation, and the taste is not far behind! Delicious! CRAB FRIED RICE..... so light fluffy... flavorful.... yum! CRISPY LEMONGRASS CATFISH ..Whole catfish crispy-fried and topped with lemongrass, fresh mint, red onion, garlic, cashews, crispy basils and a homemade semi-spicy dressing.......Yes!!! again..... Yes!!!!  For some odd reason I did not get this on my first visit to Arawan, but I will highly recommend you try the catfish! Even if you are like me and not a big catfish fan.... this one is different... it is Amazing!!!! I beg you... try the catfish! Our dessert was the Banana Puff. It is Caramel banana ice creme, crispy puff pastry, banana, strawberry, chantilly creme, caramel sauce, walnut, walnut chocolate sauce. Oooooo yeah! Gotta add this to your bookmarks!

88jp9coneAtmfMRpPHNvgw.text: From the dilapidated parking lot you walk in and are magically transported to a lovely restaurant with simple and elegant decoration. Rare for me to give out 5 stars, but I was impressed by everything here at Arawan.   Friendly service, the waitress Kim not only asked our names but shook our hand in a genuine greeting. The entire staff was friendly and smiling, and service was on point.  The food was delicious and beautifully presented. My friend and I went with Tom Kha soup, garlic short ribs, and Arawan Pad Thai. The photos say it all for presentation, my mouth says YUM. Prices are decent too, $58 for everything including the Mango Island dessert (this was soooooo good).  I'll definitely be back, again and again. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a wonderful dining experience without paying top dollar.

Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arawan pad thai...lovely presentation

GA1DI-xcYa5zU9xVu8aivw.text: Located in weird strip mall but once you enter the restaurant the ambience is pleasant and cute.  Tom yum soup is  one the best i had. Drunken noodles and pad thai also pretty amazing.  Desserts were ok, not great that i would have then again.

s24ESkTQT9wm7q4c_P-GNg.text: Unbelievable food! The cream brulee was the best I've ever had! Top notch service and amazing ambiance. Try the short rib, you will not regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1YokVHqA7PXP-iem63sDAQ.text: This review is way overdue.  My friend & I dined here for lunch last August for my birthday and the food and experience was memorable. We ordered the papaya salad, tom yum soup & pad Thai. All items tasted fresh & delicious.  I'd recommend this restaurant if you're in the area.

Kf-DCyA87cmDirbGf9ryBw.text: The food was tasty, spicy and fresh. Service was on point, our strawberry water was always filled. They also had a mango desert that is a must. It's a combination of flavors and textures that make your eyes light up!   Arawan is definitely off the Vegas strip and doesn't carry the big Vegas flare, but it has good food and service. If you're looking to get away from the glam for a meal, venture to this small strip and give the locals some love. It definitely looks slightly sketchy from the outside, the strip the restaurant was located in made me feel vulnerable because I didn't know where it was exactly, but once we found it, I felt more secure. There are lots of vacant spaces available for rent and needs cleaned up a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family style servings.

PAJ26j9QbDjmYbbPxdsaGw.text: Items Selected: Thai Iced Tea Crispy Wontons Red Curry Fish Cake Ahi Tuna Larb Arawan Pad Thai Squid-ink Drunken Noodles Duck Palow Sweet Sensation Earthquake  Open now for just under two years, the choice to join a plaza already featuring world famous Lotus of Siam and Komol Restaurant originally an odd choice that had many labeling them 'that new Thai place near Lotus,' Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert has defied the odds by etching out their own unique style of Thai cuisine that is quite unlike any other in Las Vegas, the duo of Chefs Jui and Gail creating some truly beautiful dishes with a focus on quality ingredients that do not compromise authenticity.  Technically located in "Commercial Center," though if any local is asked the answer to "where is it?" almost always revolves around its Beard Award Winning competition, Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert joins most of the Las Vegas off-Strip ethnic options in being largely understated in its outward appearance, a noon arrival on Saturday finding the inside perhaps 1/4 full but soon to fill past 2/3 over the course of the next thirty minutes, Its soft soundtrack and light decor making the space seem spacious yet intimate, the overhead lighting great for photographs of the sort of Thai Cuisine that most certainly deserves a Kodak moment.  Dividing the menu into Signatures, Starters, Entrees and Desserts, each section offering ten or more items at prices that are competitive to other fine-dining Thai restaurants in town, service at Arawan is of the gracious, yet not-entirely-organized style familiar to those who've dined in similar restaurants across Sin City, the meal beginning with a small plate of Wonton Chips and a housemade sweet and spicy Dipping Sauce, the Thai Iced Tea ordered mere moments after sitting down completely forgotten until another young woman was reminded, but still arriving more than five minutes after the first plates.  No doubt a refined concept, the focus here moreso on the food and its presentation than esoteric plates or expansive wine list of Lotus or Chada Thai, a perusal of starters shows everything from Spring Rolls to Larb and Papaya Salad present and accounted for, the more interesting options a quartet of Fish Cakes spiked with Red Curry that fry up light and oilless as well as the Ahi Tuna "Larb" that forgoes the typical ground Meat in favor of Poke-style Sashimi Cubes bathed in a spicy blend of Citrus, Mango, Avocado and crispy Shallots.   Moving on to entrees, all three taken from the Signatures though staples such as Drunken Noodles, Curries, and Mint or Ginger dishes are available with a choice of Meat toppings or Tofu, Arawan's Crispy Duck fares similarly to many in the area by way of slow roasting followed by a high temperature finish that leaves center pieces moist and succulent while unfortunately dehydrating the edges, the restaurant's eponymous Pad Thai performing more consistently and one-upping most by placing thin Noodles and Chicken punched up with Fish Sauce beneath an edible net, the two butterflied Prawns on top alone commanding the whole plate's cost at any Casino in town without being nearly as attractive, filling or complex.  Nearly lured in by both the Rib Eye and the Short Rib, but eventually deciding that something as unique as Squid Ink Drunken Noodles probably warranted a look, Arawan takes a chance at offending purists by replacing the flat Rice Noodles more commonly seen with Black Spaghetti and a similar spice profile focused on Thai Basil and Green Peppercorns, the flavors not particularly 'authentic' when paired to Cod, de-shelled Shrimp, Mussels and Scallops but delicious nonetheless, and easily the meal's most highly recommendable savory.  Happy to give any restaurant including "Dessert" in its title a chance to wow with sweets, Chef Gail clearly not one to be satisfied with Sticky Rice and Mango slices or Tempura Plantains, it was with tough choices made to account for both time and capacity that two items were selected from a total of nine, the Sweet Sensation taking the aforementioned Banana idea to new heights by wrapping the torched Fruit in a thin Pancake and sweetening it with condensed milk and sugar before adding Thai Tea Ice Cream, while a dish called "Earthquake" replicates Le Cirque's Petit Boule de Chocolat presentation, replacing the flavors inside with Lychee sorbet and Fruity Candies that add an extra layer of taste and texture to the melted Chocolate and hot, pureed Raspberries.  ***1/2: No doubt committed to its vision, most of the 'modern' ideas performing very well while desserts are not only delicious but aesthetically pleasing, Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert is a place worth checking out in the same vein as Nittaya's Secret Kitchen in Summerlin, a change of pace from all the other Thai spots in town with an ambiance and variety of plates good for both the adventurous 'foodie' or couples just looking for something new to try on date night.

WgLFT29aUV4DmJyA4-5O1Q.text: Exceptional service and glorious food. The green curry scallops were incredible and my husband loved the red curry duck.   To the idiot sitting next to us threatening a bad Yelp review if she didn't get free ice cream and cake for her oh-so-important 25th Birthday, everyone was hoping you choked on it. Shame on you.

lz2jVam6JZKgjSTHjVKiQg.text: Great dinner experience, excellent food choices and easy to read menu. Very friendly staff.  Enjoyed the Checkin Curry and all the appetizers, not so much for the Pad Thai, little bitter. Definitely coming back for deserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee

OIhlk8RHMjZ9__TMW2P7pA.text: Amazing atmosphere, great service, Arawan Thai bistro was the place to go while visiting Las Vegas. I got the drunken noodle with beef. Russell, our waiter, did a fantastic job also.

E44qFe1qP0gyaJc12_t1Pw.text: From the outside this place looks like a dive. However, it is a transformation when you walk in. Very upscale modern look. Very nice and casual dress is ok.   From a food perspective, my dish (spicy mint-vegan style) was excellent. I ordered medium spice and it was just the right spice. Very fresh and delicious! I'll definitely be back.  I would say that if you are in a hurry, the service is not completely fast. That's not a negative as you can tell the food is freshly cooked. I put this out there as you may want to have some time to enjoy the ambience and the relaxing environment.

Tvwhm5kjR_OkwnSV41lofA.text: Arawan is often considered among the best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas if not the BEST, and that status has earned this restaurant a spot on many foodie's bucket list.   This place is a gem! From the music, food taste, presentation and service... this place has AMAZING food! Their flavors are exquisite and dishes very colorful and aromatic!  The area where restaurant is located and the rather expected entrance might fool the first timers, but once you've had a chance to try the Ahi Tuna Larb, Arawan Pad Thai, the Duck Drunken Noodles or any of the distinctive Thai dishes, you'll understand why the restaurant has such a following.   Patissier Gail is always around assuring satisfaction and making sugar works of art worthy of a photograph. The presentation, attention to detail, exotic flavors, ambiance and service, Arawan serves more than food, you're treated with an entire experience. Art for your eyes and a symphony of flavors to your palate this place DELIVERS!   Great work! When in Vegas, you HAVE to visit this hidden gem.   If you want to experience Thai whit the most modern and tasteful approach, you HAVE to come to Arawan.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazingly constructed dishes. A traditional dish with an unexpected presentation.
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xVi9-cyBhYT-1Gavi4-z_w.text: Just found mah fav Thai restaurant in town. Their presentation is really nice. The food tastes decent. Price is also reasonable. The restaurant is so cute too, so it's pretty perfect for a date  If you come with a family, you should order the fried cat fish. The portion is so huge so it should be good for table of 4-5 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hhtzN3CE4SZTc0H-zvv2Ow.text: Arawan bistro was delicious! They have this great lunch special where for $9.99 you can get a soup, dish, AND dessert. My family and I came and got 3 dishes to split. We got the pad Thai, panang curry, and mixed vegetables. The pad Thai was a little too soggy but a great generous portion. Mixed veggies came with our choice of protein to which we chose tofu. The star of the show was panang curry. I can't even begin on how amazing the flavors are. It's sweet, spicy, and creamy. The dessert my parents got were chocolate cake but because it had nuts in it (which I'm allergic to), they gave me Thai tea ice cream instead which was so delicious.   Overall a solid place with fast service, great deals, & great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lXEJyvlv1CLmv2lIgYkAYA.text: Arawan serves quality Thai food.  From the outside, this restaurant does not look promising, but once you step inside you will be pleasantly surprised. I have only been to Arawan for lunches, which is a great deal. $10 gets you a soup of the day, which changes daily, a delicious entree, & a dessert of the day. At other restaurant's, you might get a mediocre cabbage and carrot soup, but here, you can taste the quality of their food from the beginning. Their pad Thai is great and has a perfect amount of tamarind paste. Desserts have all been not too sweet but just sweet enough. I can't wait to try more!  It is a very cute place for a date night! I will continue to come and recommend it to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch pad Thai tofu
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake dessert w/ lunch
Photo of Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch pad Thai

UmCyYOBfupIkolXELhpNJw.text: Don't be put off by the outer appearance of this place.  And don't go to the Thai restaurant right next door, that easily could happen.  This strip mall is so odd looking and no definition/distinction between one address to the next. The food and inner restaurant are fabulous! We had their Chicken Satay; egg drop soup; soft shell crab; Pad kea mow; Pad se ew and fresh spring rolls.   Everything was fresh and delicious! If you are on the east side, and want Thai food, this is your place to eat! Enjoy

gHmG1vVSkZXW0AdDGOAq_A.text: Seriously, from looking at the outside or where this place is located, it was enough to make me question if I really wanted Thai food but I'm so glad my friend convinced me to go!!! TOTAL HIDDEN GEM!  Upon driving up to the restaurant, it is located in a little strip mall area on the other side of the stratosphere (red flag number one) and the exterior of the shop because it is connected on a strip mall looked run down and super dingy (red flag number two for me). It really does go to show that you shouldn't judge a book (or restaurant) by its cover! When you walk in, the atmosphere is COMPLETELY different! There's soft music playing in the background, the restaurant is nice and clean and pretty spacious and the staff there was simply amazing!  We got there for lunch and got the lunch special. My friend got the panang curry that came with rice, a side of soup AND a dessert too! I got the drunken noodles that came with a side of soup and a dessert and man, both of our food was AMAZING! We ate it so fast and didn't even talk because we were just savoring it! Plus, each lunch special was only 9.99 and the portions were just right! It was enough for both of us to share and we had some leftovers to take home too! The panang curry had such a burst of flavor to it with juicy pieces of chicken to accompany the dish. They aren't skimpy on the chicken pieces either, both dishes had generous amounts of chicken to it! The drunken noodles had fresh basil added to give us that pop of freshness for a dish.  All in all, I am going to come back here! I only wish there was another place closer to Henderson!! If you are in the mood for Thai food and are near the area, give this place a go!!!

dMynA1yUhbtzIoUlS02sUg.text: Having heard so much about Arawan, we decided to try it.  Let me say that it is a little hard to find.  It's located in a very dilapidated plaza surrounded by shuttered and abandoned stores and restaurants, and once you get into the plaza you really have to keep your eyes peeled in order to see the tiny and inconspicuous Arawan.  Inside, the place is clean and well-kept though not as opulent or grand as Lotus of Siam.  They seemed to be having some air-conditioning problems the evening we visited as they had a large portable unit running.    The staff were very friendly, and they have a large selection of dishes to choose from.  We started with Chicken Satay bites which were juicy and served with an absolutely delicious peanut sauce. For entrees we tried the Arawan Pad Thai and the Short Rib Yellow Curry.  Two home runs for sure.  The Pad Thai was served surrounded by an amazing egg net and featured large prawns atop the dish.  It was delicious!  The yellow curry was equally delicious and tasted like a rich, complex curry with lots of subtle flavors.  The beef was fork-tender.  Save room for dessert!  They were sold out of the creme brulee, so we tried the Sweet Sensation.  This was quite good and a bit like a softer banana spring roll.  The thai tea ice cream was perfectly flavored.    They do not offer a full bar, but soft drinks were refilled without charge even though they seemed to be from a can rather than a fountain.    Overall this was a delicious Thai dining experience though I do wish they would relocate to a space that would be more worthy of the quality of this restaurant.

djb5PH6LZAFwvyfOnKtp0A.text: My absolute FAVORITE Thai restaurant in Las Vegas, and, yes, I've been to Lotus of Siam... multiple times... and I've never been as impressed as I am whenever I dine at Arawan.   Presentation is amazing and flavors are incredible. Prices are reasonable. Service is typical but you don't come here for that, you come for everything else that is extraordinary.

JPEL0kYODaS3V00oj8SY0A.text: Soft shell crab curry Actually I really love Soft-shell-crab-curry. So I've eaten at many restaurants as far as I know. The Crab curry in this place is really soft and has good flavor.  Roasted duck / Ribeye steak As I know, The Thai food is famous for Curry and Pad thai, I didn't expect what I ordered delicious. But Ribeye was really good, And The Roasted duck was exceeded my expectations.  Scallop green curry / Pad thai It was copious! It served with many shrimp and scallop. it was great to enjoy with everyone.  Desert Mango Ice dessert was little bit weird. Because it has rice, I never seen such a dessert. But Tastes and The server was really good.

F4UMKwoxCFjbCRXjg6GB7A.text: My friends and I were in Vegas for the weekend and mutually agreed that Thai food was (and always is) the go to food. I really enjoyed this place and am so glad we decided on it. The restaurant is a little small but well decorated. We also had the best service.   Chicken Larb - So flavorful. One of my favorite Thai dishes so I had to get it. Different from the lettuce I'm used to eating it with but I'm not complaining.   Crispy pork and Chinese broccoli - Decent... I could've probably done without. That pork belly was indeed super crispy but not a must try on the menu for me.  Pad See Ew - Good.. not particularly special, however I have never had bad pad see ew either so it was up to par with what I'm used to.  Egg Papaya Salad - NEVER in my life have I seen papaya salad served this way before!! And with Vietnamese ham, salted egg and fried pork rinds?? Unreal. I don't know how it works but it totally does. It's a symphony of flavor in my mouth and each ingredient compliments the other. You mix it yourself. Oh yeah, totally spicy too and everything we ordered was 3 stars but it was amazing. Loved this dish.   Pad Thai - One word.. sweet. And sweet isn't how I typically like my Pad Thai but I don't usually get it anyway (it was for the others in my group) so I'm indifferent about this dish.   Stars of the show were the papaya salad and chicken larb. I only wish the portions were bigger because they seemed so small and much smaller than what I'm used to in Seattle.

Z30Q5B2iZnpXCufHuDgFog.text: This is by far the best Thai restaurant we've ever experienced. Aesthetically the food was gorgeous and it actually tasted even better. Thank you Ken for your hospitality!! They even put a strawberry in our waters!!

2XFo4tWJZiuChqGcqmKULQ.text: If someone asked for a 'hidden gem' in Vegas, this place would come to mind.  I keep forgetting how 'shady' the surrounding neighborhood and strip mall is the couple of times I have been here.  The outside of Arawan is so discreet we passed it by several times and thought we were in the wrong plaza.  However, it is worth the effort as the experience here always delivers.  You can just tell when a place cares and here the chef has a passion for the food and the pastry chef has a passion for pastry.  Service is very efficient and professional as you'd expect from a Thai restaurant.  What makes this particular restaurant special is the attention to detail and presentation.  Pad Thai here seems to be the house special as it is pad thai with chicken but then it is wrapped in an egg net and served with two giant prawns.  It is by far the most extravagant pad thai I have ever had.  Short rib with yellow curry is in a class of its own as the beef is fork tender the flavor of the curry sauce is so balanced with the fragranced white rice.  It is truly a match made in Thai heaven.  I really think this would be great place for a date as the ambiance is intimate and somewhat romantic.

Everything was good for the price and the vibe.  The only thing is it's located at a sketch place; however, it is a hidden gem!

We were greeted with awesome customer service, our server was beyond knowledgeable about the menu offering suggestions. We were very well taken care of.   We ordered the thai tea,  fortune blossoming tea,  chicken satay bites, pad thai with beef,  garlic shortribs, and the chocolate lava cake.   Wow. Nothing disappointed at all. Everything was beautifully presented, and the taste was amazing. Our server even explained re: the prep time for the lava cake ( I already know all about that cake tho)  Even though they closed at 10:00pm they never rushed us, they allowed us to take our time.   Would truly recommend this was wonderful food- the pricing is a reflection of quality and presentation   Location Sahara/ Maryland-- ample parking

c__P1vR3Y4Z8a4HjMR2AeA.text: Arawan Thai Bistro and Dessert- -where tradition meets sophistication.   Tucked away in the heart of Las Vegas Commercial Center, this venue lives up to its hype as a Treasure of the city and an Extraordinary find!   Fresh modern interior with a vibrant ambiance and further impressing guests with their excellent service!  Serving up Thai food with a modern twist combines with an extensive menu that captures the diverse flavors, making way for stylish and unforgettable dishes.   Tasting through their most popular items on the menu starting with a complimentary crispy wontons accompanied by a sweet chili dipping sauce paired with a glass of water garnished with a slice of strawberry sets a lovely tone for the evening.   For starters:   Plum Shrimp was a successful play on two contrasting textures. The crispy noddles exterior wrapped around a succulent shrimp interior enhanced by the refreshing Orange Plum sauce was simply Delicious!   Thai Lemongrass Chicken Wings were dry coupled with the unpalatable tamarind sauce left very little to be desired.   For our main courses:  Super tender Short Rib bathing in a rich and creamy Yellow Curry with a subtle coconut flavor has all the components to make one delightfully harmonious dish!   Shrimp Pad Thai had a nice balance of sweet and savory flavors. Dressed up beautifully with shrimps and a delicate egg dome design- - a splash of lime brightened up the dish and brings it all together. Not only bold in flavors, the plating was also aesthetically pleasing!  Crab Fried Rice while simple in preparation, did not lack in flavors! Meticulously prepared with the crab flavor shining through in every bite!    Venture off the Strip and join the ranks of adventurous eaters in trying this marvelous Thai bistro!

i_7WTZd55lWxwjZqpqgM9w.text: Came here for a quick lunch and glad we did!  We didn't have reservations but since it was very early we were able to get sat.   We started off with a spring roll appetizer that was very well cooked and had great flavor. I ordered the duck noodle soup and wifey ordered the lobster pad Thai. The noodle soup was rich in flavor and I did enjoy it. The duck was plenty and did get a few breast slices along with the usual bony parts. The duck was cooked very nicely and the skin roasted very well.   The pad Thai came with this very cool looking egg "cage" with a nice size lobster tail on top. The portion was big enough for both to share and it had great flavor.  The staff was really nice and attentive and we spoke for a bit about how long they've been open and how they can be super busy during a big convention, so do call ahead and make a reservation.  Although not in the best area, still a great place to check out!

wC6yxUsT9zMoH-Sz6fWLUQ.text: This is way off the beaten path when it comes to Vegas strip life... But if you are willing venture out to this True hole in the wall strip mall, you will eat absolutely delish Thai food.  The food here is truly amazing and you'll want to go with a big group so you can order one of everything on the menu! Arawan Thai is such a gem and like any good find you have to go a bit out of your way, but when you get inside you are going to have a great experience.  The service was great, the prices are really reasonable for the quality food, and the drinks are priced well too! For Vegas this is a total score in every possible way.  If you want legit Thai food and you are willing to go a bit out of your way, then dont hesitate! You are going to love the food and want to try everything on the menu. They are making such yummy food, I can't wait to go back!

XruDx9Jlje5BLdBvDVfT_w.text: The consistent great reviews here on Yelp don't lie--this place was awesome. I got the fried duck with a side of red curry, and my wife got the chicken pad Thai. We split two appetizers, the arawan roll and egg rolls. The fried duck was really good. The amount of meat was smaller than expected given the price but considering it was more of an uncommon meat and the fact that it tasted great, it didn't bother me too much. The pad Thai was a lot of food, and it was just the right amount of spice. Their spice scale for everything on the menu with a pepper beside it (curries, pad Thai and other dishes) is mild, medium, and hot. From other Thai places, they said it's comparable to a 1, 5, and 10, respectively.   I wasn't too much of a fan of the arawan roll. It was too overpowering of vegetables. The egg rolls, however, were really good.   Service was great. We had a team of wait staff serve us versus just one person, and they were always quick to fill our water as well as ask us if we needed anything. Our food came out in a timely manner as well.    As others have noted, the location is ... Well, let's just say it doesn't feel like we were in the safest of neighborhoods based upon looks alone. But don't judge a book or in this case, restaurant by it's cover/building by it's looks!  Ultimately, we never felt unsafe, and everything from the food to the service was great! Definitely recommend this Thai restaurant

Their menu is short and sweet. Containing traditional items like cake and ice cream then having their own desserts that are unique. I tried the mango island, I would order it again next time around.
